title: Reddit CEO Steve Huffman sells $9.4 million in stock
author: Investing.com
excerpt: Reddit CEO Steve Huffman sells $9.4 million in stock
text: Steve Huffman, CEO and President of Reddit, Inc. (NASDAQ:RDDT), recently executed a series of stock transactions, selling a substantial portion of his holdings in the company. According to a recent SEC filing, Huffman sold a total of 130,408 shares of Reddit's Class A Common Stock on October 15, 2024. The shares were sold at prices ranging from $75.10 to $76.39, generating approximately $9.4 million in total. The transactions were carried out under a pre-established Rule 10b5-1 trading plan, which Huffman adopted on May 21, 2024. This plan allows executives to sell shares at predetermined times, helping to avoid potential accusations of insider trading. Following these sales, Huffman holds 657,738 shares directly and 800 shares indirectly through The XYZ Revocable Trust. These transactions reflect Huffman's ongoing management of his equity in the company. Investors and market watchers will likely scrutinize these moves closely, as insider transactions can sometimes provide insights into a company's future prospects. In other recent news, Reddit's financial performance has shown significant strides. The company's Q2 revenue surged by 54%, reaching $281.2 million and surpassing analyst estimates of $253.6 million. Additionally, the net loss of Reddit reduced to $10.1 million from $41.1 million a year ago, while the adjusted EBITDA turned positive at $39.5 million. Jefferies initiated coverage on Reddit's stock with a Buy rating, based on the anticipation of Reddit's EBITDA more than doubling in the upcoming two years. Reddit's user growth, considered to be the highest among its peers, was a major factor in this optimistic outlook. Further, Reddit announced plans to expand its AI-powered machine translation services to 35 additional countries, a move that was applauded by Deutsche Bank and JMP Securities. Analyst firms such as B.Riley, Piper Sandler, Loop Capital, and Needham have also reflected positive outlooks on Reddit's performance, with price target upgrades and reiterated Buy ratings. These recent developments highlight Reddit's strong financial performance and promising growth trajectory, as recognized by multiple analyst firms. Reddit's unique position in the market, its potential for robust top-line growth, margin expansion, and the expectation of the company to experience significant user growth, make it a compelling topic for investors.
